intro: Taraxacum rechingeri, commonly known as the Rechinger's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and a yellow flowering head that produces a distinctive seed dispersal mechanism. Native to Central Asia, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant's flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
